Table 1: Screening Ligands for Ni-Catalyzed Asymmetric Hydrogenation of 4-Phenyl-5H-1,2,3-oxathiazole 2,2-dioxide NR, no reaction; NA, not available. Unless otherwise noted, all reactions were carried out with a Ni(OAc) 2 /ligand/substrate 1 (0.1 mmol) ratio of 1:1.1:20 in 1.0 mL MeOH under 60 atm H 2 at 80°C for 24 h. The configuration of 2a was determined by comparing the optical rotation data with those reported in the literature (Wang et al., 2008; Kang et al., 2010; Lee et al., 2011) (1a) aConversion was determined by1H NMR analysis.bee was determined by chiral high-performance liquid chromatography analysis.c1.0 mol% catalyst loading. NR, no reaction; NA, not available
Table 2: Screening Solvents for Ni-Catalyzed Asymmetric Hydrogenation of 4-Phenyl-5H-1,2,3-oxathiazole 2,2-dioxide NR, no reaction; NA, not available. Unless otherwise noted, all reactions were carried out with a Ni(OAc) 2 /( S , S )-Ph-BPE/substrate 1 (0.1 mmol) ratio of 1:1.1:100 in 1.0 mL solvent under 60 atm H 2 at 80°C for 24 h; the catalyst was pre-complexed in MeOH (0.1 mL for each reaction vial). (1a) aConversion was determined by1H NMR analysis.bee was determined by chiral high-performance liquid chromatography analysis. NR, no reaction; NA, not available
Table 3: Substrate Scope Study for Ni-Catalyzed Asymmetric Hydrogenation of Cyclic Sulfamidate Imines Unless otherwise noted, all reactions were carried out with a Ni(OAc) 2 /( S , S )-Ph-BPE/substrate 1 (0.1 mmol) ratio of 1:1.1:100 in 1.0 mL CF 3 CH 2 OH under 60 atm H 2 at 80°C for 24 h. Conversion was determined by 1 H NMR analysis. Yield is isolated yield. The ee value was determined by high-performance liquid chromatography on a chiral column
